definition: to kiss (on the mouth)
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: And when the king was come over, the king kissed Barzillai, and blessed him; and he returned unto his own place.
sentences.chinese: 王與巴西萊親嘴，爲他祝福，巴西萊就回本地去了。

sentences.english: And hast not suffered me to kiss my sons and my daughters?
sentences.chinese: 又不容我與外孫和女兒親嘴。

sentences.english: The pair, who are a couple in real life, also took home the Best Kiss award.
sentences.chinese: 這對於現實餬口情侶還捧走了最佳親嘴獎。

sentences.english: Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity.
sentences.chinese: 你們要用愛心彼此親嘴問安。

sentences.english: And Joab took Amasa by the beard with the right hand to kiss him.
sentences.chinese: 就用右手抓住亞瑪撒的鬍子，要與他親嘴。

sentences.english: Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy multiplies kisses.
sentences.chinese: 朋友加的傷痕，出於忠誠，仇敵連連親嘴，卻是多餘。

sentences.english: And his father Isaac said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.
sentences.chinese: 他父親以撒對他說，我兒，你上前來與我親嘴。

sentences.english: when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.
sentences.chinese: 我在外頭遇見你就與你親嘴，誰也不輕看我。

sentences.english: Cor. 13:12 Greet one another with a holy kiss.
sentences.chinese: 林後十三12你們要用聖別的親嘴彼此問安。

sentences.english: Salute one another with an holy kiss.
sentences.chinese: 你們親嘴問安，彼此務要聖潔。

sentences.english: They broke the news director in the studio too intimate, non-stop kissing people can not stand.
sentences.chinese: 導演爆料兩人在片場太過親暱，不停親嘴讓人受不了。

sentences.english: But Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?
sentences.chinese: 耶穌對他說，猶大，你用親嘴的暗號賣人子嗎。

sentences.english: Smooch A young man smooches with a girl in the car.
sentences.chinese: 一個年輕人在汽車裏摟着一個姑娘親嘴。

sentences.english: I cannot rest until he kisses me with the kiss of his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我無法平靜直到他用口與我親嘴。

sentences.english: Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer.
sentences.chinese: 應對正直的，猶如與人親嘴。

sentences.english: And Joseph fell upon his father's face， and wept upon him， and kissed him.
sentences.chinese: 約瑟伏在他父親的面上哀哭，與他親嘴。

definition: to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to talk back/to answer back
to apologize
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
sour face/scowling face/CL:張|张[zhang1],副[fu4]
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
(coll.) pushover/soft touch
to act shamelessly/to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc/to act dumb/to act as if sth never happened
lit. dress up as God, play the devil (idiom); fig. to mystify/to deceive people/to scam
carelessly and haphazardly/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
jumbo/king-sized
to flirt
